comment: Does not understand what he is teaching. When asked a question, he generally does not know how to answer. Minus points depending on the person, you can have the same answer as a classmate but receive different grades.
Professor Milad was extremely kind; he didn't care if he lost time explaining over and over the same problem or concept. He was there to truly help us succeed.
There's a lot of homework in this class, but professor Saghebfar is pretty reasonable and gives lots of extra credits. I put in a lot of work, but not more than my other classes.

Nice person. Explains things well with a clear structure, so I came away feeling like I had a solid understanding of the material. Tests are 80% of the grade and he made the first one more difficult than homework/examples w/ missing information, so he had to offer a bunch of extra credit to compensate. Had about a 50% response rate on my emails.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: He basically just reads over his slides. His accent makes it hard to understand. Luckily, the class is not hard at all, and he gives many extra credits. The midterms and final are just like the homework, no surprise.
Lectures are easy to understand. He answers all the questions during the class. Exams are similar to homeworks and class examples.

Literally, he didn' teach us how to do. Half of the class was on twitch. He doesn't try to help students at all and his lectures are several slides from everywhere! When confronted about issues, he often brushes them aside and remains vague.

He's so nice! Very helpful and tries to make a real connection with the students. I have him for lab and he's always willing to answer any questions we may have, with no judgement. He gives the necessary material to do the work correctly. May not be the easiest to reach through email, but he will stay after class if you have questions.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: The lecture is just reading off the slides. The recent 5-star review on here is very inaccurate. I feel he does not know about the subject.
He really is a good teacher and very helpful. I learned more in this course than any other online/hybrid course this semester.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures
